Text.value: Welcome to the Leap Day open beta!
Defeat those spirits! They will now always give you loot! Also, it's how you save the world! Leap on, Leapers!
Probable fix to the annoying Recipedia exception after a reconnect. Turn that frown upside down!
Worlds should no longer generate with resources directly next to Ice Totems.
New Item! The Elbow Crane is now available in the market! Try it for free until February 15th.
If you have purchased prince inventory slots, they will now appear on all of your princes. Inventory slots are no longer tied to individual princes. Hurray!
You can share your city with friends by pressing ctrl+c to copy the game link. Updated so it shows what you were last looking at.
Chat history is now preserved if you pick up and move a Telephone. If you pick up another prince's Telephone, they will have to place a new Telephone to restore the chat.
The start of a new tutorial... Leap and learn!
New loader for Unity. Scary scary! But also hopefully more better for some people.
Gold income is now completely rate-based rather than immediate on delivery.
New Item! The Stout Tower is now available in the market, starting with a free trial.
Trapped Flan have rebelled against cramped working conditions! For all new games, Flan only transfer goods if they can hop about in a cage-free environment.
New Item! The Carousel Crane is now available in the market, starting with a free trial.
New Item! The Fast Train will blow your mind. It is also available in the market and has a free trial.
You can now invite friends to play with you! Each player can have up to two active invites per game. Enjoy!
Microing boss completion should no longer work. Only goods that can be delivered during one Leap Day should count.
If you use a Key to unlock a miniboss, you should now get credit as if you had participated in its defeat.
A few small chat improvements, including the ability to largely play with the chat window open and to drag the window.
Hotkeys added for main selection panel.
Fixed some issues with gold calculation.
Various totem fixes. New system likely incoming shortly. Thanks for all the great feedback!
Level displayed on Prince is not yet used. But soon! Soon!
New maps available! Including varying game lengths and number of players! More exciting than a beta should be!
Fix to carousel crane rendering issue.
New Item! Catapults are now available in the market, starting with a free trial.
New leveling system is in! Earn XP, level up, and unlock new maps!
Showing Gold Per Hour in the Gold Per Leap Day mouseover.
Fix to loss of gold on pickup for roads after restart.
Many fixes.
Not too happy with your current game? Now you can leave whenever you like!
The Royal Report can now be viewed before the game is over.
Abandonded thrones can now be reclaimed by new players through invites or matchmaking!
We've added several new items to the Recipedia. Oh the complexity!
Gentle massaging of the levelling curve. We won't rest until we love it.
New Expert Maps! If they get solved within 24 hours, Dan Cook claims he'll tear his beard out. Good luck with that!
Prices no longer ramp across common types but, instead, are per-object type.

Description.value: Wrong ingredients in. Junk come out. If only you used the Recipedia...
A bulbous protein rich berry. Clever monkeys can cook it into almost any yummy delicacy.
Once, the living trunk of a majestic tree. Now dead.
Cool clear pond water. Scum free!
Rough stone from a local mountain.
Stout and full of water. You can shoot fish in it.
A hard wood that has lived a hard life. Misses its baby acorns.
Fresh, hot loafs right out of the oven. Try slices dribbled with honey and melted butter.
The finest red clay bricks this side of Greater Flandon.
Distilled berries yield a harsh liquor that puts hair in places you really don't want hair.
Planks hand-planed by an elderly master craftsman. Each wood shaving is so fine you can see the sunset shine through.
Dab a little of this under your chin and the flan come runnin'
Sparkly bits of glitter cut with a water wheel.
Savory stew made from roots, sausage and your mother's soupy secrets. The steam fogs your glasses.
Fractured stone under great heat reveals a metallic core. Ore! Go forth and forge a vast industry!
The nubby petals, when ground in a Flannish mortar, produce a red powder that sets the senses aflame.
Twelve parts sand, three parts trona, two parts lime. Brought to a bubble and then made into church windows.
The home cooked meal you miss so much.
A white fruit-based flour used for baking. Also fun to jump into and pretend you are a ghost.
Food of the gods. The gods unfortunately were machines, so consuming mana tends to make one's tongue blister.
An intoxicating staple of winter nights spent with friends 'round a table full of food and song.
Items of worship mass produced for mass.
A poisonous beverage favored by ex-lovers and spiteful goldfish owners.
Love in a bottle. Sold in bulk to certified therapists.
Each flask contains a guaranteed five additional minutes of life. Drink slowly to avoid exploding.
These baubles cling to the curve of your breast.
Small statuettes that contain a false bottom for hiding sacrilegious items.
A black powder used in fireworks and other celebratory activities. Like the upcoming purge of the Queen's enemies.
Crystals will change type when in a prince's territory. The type of gem is different for each prince.
A banded variety of chalcedony. Ha! You are now smarter than your brother.
A green stone that reminds this scholar of your aunt's eyes on that summer dawn.
A shimmering gem of many colors. This one happens to be of the rare non-Australian variety
Fossilized sap. Occasionally pieces contain dead bugs and eternal memories.
A metal that is deeply jealous of gold and all the love it gets. Sometimes found crying itself to sleep.
Diamonds are what happens when you squeeze a tree really tightly. Quite rare due to the Purge of the Tree Squeezers in 40 AD.
A diamond dipped in blue dye
Long ago jewelers sacrificed miniature goats to turn stones red. If you hold a ruby up to your ear, you just might be able to hear the bleating.
No one likes amethyst.
A band wrought of precious materials. It speaks of a promise not always kept.
Necklaces are armor that lay bare our humdrum visage when removed. Invaluable.
A polished shield perfect for hanging on walls in order to pretend that you are manly.
Long of shaft and thick of head, these are not intended to be used on drums. The drum maker is very angry.
Snicker snack! A blade capable of severing a variety of cheeses and cutlets when one feels peckish.
Princes collect scepters much as your or I might collect shoes.
Protection from spirits and hauntings. It never seems to work out as promised in the literature.
The heavy burden of leadership built to rest upon a furrowed brow.
When a standard sized barrel just isn't enough.
The oak preferred by pirates and brigands.
A dense loaf traditionally consumed by soaking in stout
An upscale brick for rich folks that look down on red bricks as plebian.
Aged to maturity in artisanal black oak barrels, a single sip will burn your socks off.
Have a seat.
The lock on the intricate box promises more than the costume jewelry.
This classic desk was popularized in the Elder Puddingham era. No assembly required because flan are not (and never will be) Swedish.
Legalized in three states
Hammer for bashing rock. Used by the workers to the east that lost their jobs and families to the illness with no cure.
A well hopped ale
Sometimes we give bad gifts because we care too much to give fragile feeling form.
My fingers are so sticky. Are your fingers sticky too? Even If you lick them, they don't stop being sticky.
This was once a real cat, but then it was soaked in a special varnish. Now you can pet Fluffy forever.
The poor sell their fillings to be melted into ingots
'The only way to enjoy spicy food is on the way in' -Flannish proverb
This was the meal that the fisherman ate the night before he was lost at sea.
A seafarer's concoction made of weak beer, rum and a dash of lemon to chase off the scurvy.
A hearty southern meal made from beans and locals that did not pay their royal taxes.
An outdated product whose rudderless inventor is likely to go bankrupt in the next decade.
In a well ordered society, it is a neighbor's duty to report unseemly details with great gusto. The spyglass is merely a facilitator.
Now that cigars are banned in public places, consumption of brandy has doubled.
All good moments in life can be slowly stewed in a crockpot. Lift the lid, inhale and remember everything.
An English crisp.
The sort of plated meal a well off bachelor orders when attempting to impress an ingenue
Sniffless and extremely capable of non-emotional bonding.
Baked by lighting a tiny fire inside a bread crust cavity. Eaten by families on Saturday nights.
When cooking pastries only the silkiest baking flour will prevent the chef from smacking you and yelling 'Dolt!'
Wine bewitched with the sweet tears of mispent youth.
'This stealthy rowboat is surprisingly useful if you need to get rid of a body.' Sales brochure, selling point #3.
The simple fact that you do not possess this amazing hair-styling product explains everything that has gone wrong with your life.
A ring of fire. It burns, burns, burns.
When slipped upon a finger, a single twist releases a venom that makes you appear dead for 12 hours.
The sort of thing an insecure man wears in order to pretend that they aren't wearing jewelry.
Traditional dress of the high governors that stoke the fire tower flames.
All you need to do is hug your victim. Please observe that the needles face outward.
Recommended fashion for thick necked individuals with sloping shoulders.
A shield you can hide behind and still see where you are going. Two handed
A shield imbued with expensive cantrips to block the ghost of your mother from seeing what you are doing with your life.
This shield doesn't clank about like all the other shields. Stupid clanking shields.
A little bundle of chilled evil. Don't let it escape.
Those with a friend who is into carpentry, should give this as a present
Behold. Light cream drizzled over warm breadpudding. Heaven awaits.
A child, age 5, broke the last one. Replica pottery ensures that his step-father will never find out.
This barrel prefers the term 'stout' over diminutive titles like 'tiny' or 'dwarven'
Duke Elba sold his soul to the Ice Witch for one stiff drink. This is what he quaffed.
The last warriors of the Flannish took these rations on their suicide mission to vanquish the spirit lords. There are no more warrior flan.
Yes, these prayer stones are made of foam, but it is certified blessed foam.
This is what happens when you cook a barrel of monkeys
Produced by crushing dried mushrooms into powder. A single pinch can aphyxiate a room.
A meal for flan that require two seats when traveling coach.
The famous chef Rotoschooni made this dish for the Princess when he first cooked for her. They eloped that night.
An amulet for the flan that does not need to flaunt their immense wealth.
On the backside of this nondescript scepter is a spout that dispenses black whiskey.
The dour workers of the stony west fear reflections so they scuff their metal and break all foreign mirrors.
The reverse of this pendant states 'In times of need, seek the glow of friends'
An inscription on the side of the scepter reads 'By working together, greatness is inevitable'
Glowing words ring the band, spelling out 'Alone, you are nothing.'
Minions sworn to the creeping ice wear such amulet to keep the heat of love at bay.
The first of the ice lords created this vile device from an inky pool of bitterness.
If you ever stumble upon a shadow crown, burn it with fire. The world hangs in balance.
Amelia Plumson, an artist of great renown, died. Her last wish was to send a last message. This melting statue was found on her daughter's doorstep.
The sculptor of this carving was inspired by a time when he was lost in the subway. A lady with ladybug boots gave him an apple and led him home.
All good things are made of chocolate.
The nation came together to create this great work. The pride you feel comes from the bonds you built.
Friends shield us from loneliness like children shield politicians
No one knows the secret hallucinagenic ingredients of this madman's liquor.
Looks great on a lawn
If children eat this treat with their fingers, they gain the magical ability to climb walls. While giggling maniacly.
Looks so much better than a mana orb. Dear neighbor, "How about them apples?"
Time, like a rampaging herd of wild stallions, leaves behind an amazing quantity of poop.
Stop. Hammered by time. Break me down.
If you must one day put on some pants...make them sparky pants
Hide from the world inside this tiny dull space. No one can poke you now.
Every person who loves you (or your luxuriant hair) decreases your AC by 1.
This is the stuff that makes evil robots impervious to bullets.
Elegance is a small band that accents the sweet bones of the youthful wrist.
Past a certain age, it is wise to trade elegance for "Hey, stop looking at my wrinkles."
A warrior of modern romance knows that the True Love sometimes needs a small kick forward.
My loved one died. Please remember her.
The carved crown was so stunning that his people remembered him as a hero, not a drunk.
The shriveled heart of a flan that did not play nicely with others

SmallText.value: by right-clicking on them or using the shovel tool

LargeText.value: You have unused totems gathering dust

SmallText.value: Workers pave roads only if they can reach them.
Build a house or remove the road

LargeText.value: Place magical totems in the world to get bonuses

SmallText.value: They cannot be picked up again
Vote on the next goal here
to craft a new more valuable good

LargeText.value: Have a worker stop by and pick up your newly crafted good.

SmallText.value: Click Buy Goods to get more

LargeText.value: Place fire towers at the edges of the snow

SmallText.value: Make a loop in the road to keep the workers moving

LargeText.value: Hold the SHIFT KEY while dragging
You can RIGHT CLICK or RIGHT DRAG
You've run low on gold. Don't worry!

ShortDescription.value: 5 random items! Guaranteed 1 uncommon. No chance of winning a rare item.

Description.value: 5 random items! Guaranteed 1 uncommon. No chance of winning a rare item.

ShortDescription.value: 5 random items! Guaranteed 2 uncommons, and 30% chance of a rare item. (If you don't win a rare, you'll win another uncommon.) No chance of ultra-rare or legendary items... those can only be won from bosses!

Description.value: 5 random items! Guaranteed 2 uncommons, and 30% chance of a rare item. (If you don't win a rare, you'll win another uncommon.) No chance of ultra-rare or legendary items... those can only be won from bosses!

ShortDescription.value: 5 random items! Guaranteed 2 uncommons *and* 1 rare item! Plus a 10% chance of a *second* rare item! (If you don't win a second rare, you'll win another uncommon.) No chance of ultra-rare or legendary items... those can only be won from bosses!

Description.value: 5 random items! Guaranteed 2 uncommons *and* 1 rare item! Plus a 10% chance of a *second* rare item! (If you don't win a second rare, you'll win another uncommon.) No chance of ultra-rare or legendary items... those can only be won from bosses!

ShortDescription.value: This is you!
Goods are sold here
A malevolent spirit lurks within. It appears to be crafting a spell that will soon refreeze this region.

LongDescription.value: Displays the time remaining until the end of the world

ShortDescription.value: Deliver the requested goods to the towers to keep the world from freezing
A troubled spirit lurks within. Satisfy its aching heart and be rewarded for your effort.
Fire towers melt snow
Stout towers melt less snow, but are far cheaper

LongDescription.value: Never underestimate the power of a tiny flan in a tiny tower

ShortDescription.value: Standard cranes transfer goods in 180 degree arcs

LongDescription.value: Use cranes for trading and connecting seperate road loops

ShortDescription.value: Elbow cranes transfer goods in 90 degree arcs

LongDescription.value: This transfer station can't turn as far.

ShortDescription.value: Crane that can hold four goods at one time

LongDescription.value: An unusual crane with four access points

ShortDescription.value: The smallest of factories
A larger factory
A cheap factory that uses fewer goods

LongDescription.value: All goods made in the miser factory are worth 2/3rds less

ShortDescription.value: Flings goods recklessly through the air and catches them
A single worker emerges from here
Two workers emerge from here
The worker in this home can carry two goods at once
A single rail car emerges from here
A single slow rail car emerges from here
A single fast rail car emerges from here
A single hopping rail car emerges from here
Slow but cheap path for workers
Fast but more expensive

LongDescription.value: Produces a worn cobblestone. This tome was owned by the renowned Wendeling.

ShortDescription.value: Very fast for rail cars only
Creates an in-world chat stream. Can be placed in other's territory.
Unlocks the tomb of a troubled spirit
Shows the way to the Ghost of the Survivalist

LongDescription.value: Shows the way to the Ghost of the Survivalist

ShortDescription.value: Shows the way to Mr. Sophisto

LongDescription.value: Shows the way to Mr. Sophisto

LongDescription.value: Shows the way to the Ghost of Mister Jones

ShortDescription.value: Shows the way to the Ghostess of a Disco Queen

LongDescription.value: Shows the way to the Ghostess of a Disco Queen

Description.value: Gives {Value1:N0} coins
+{Value1}% value of Water
Gems make +{Value1} gem for all gems in your area
Watch Towers gain +{Value1}% radius
Make stone harvestable
All goods are worth +{Value1}%
Game lasts {Value1} Day longer
Watch Towers gain +{Value1}% radius
Transportation items are {Value1}% less.
Days are {Value1}% longer
Game lasts {Value1} Days longer
Reclaim your land

ShortDescription.value: Totem that, when placed, unlocks your tutorial village. Totems can not be removed once placed.

LongDescription.value: Nothing delights the new worker like regaining hard-won resources. Place and rejoice!

Description.value: Harvest +{Value1} stone per adjacent Rock
Harvest +{Value1} wood per adjacent Tree

LongDescription.value: Place adjacent to a tree to increase wood production - Available for sale in beta as a temporary test

LongDescription.value: Place adjacent to a tree to ensure you don't harvest wood - Available for sale in beta as a temporary test

LongDescription.value: Place adjacent to any Resources to ensure you don't harvest any Goods - Available for sale in beta as a temporary test

ShortDescription.value: Satisfy this altar and receive its blessing.
Satisfy this altar and receive its blessed spirits
Satisfy this altar and receive its perfumed blessing
Satisfy this altar and receive bread not wrought of flesh
Satisfy this altar and receive a stewed blessing

Description.value: Harvest +{Value1} water per Pond in your territory

ShortDescription.value: Satisfy this altar and receive its blessing.

Description.value: Harvest +{Value1} water per adjacent Pond

ShortDescription.value: Satisfy this altar and receive its blessing.
Flan love to rock!

Description.value: Once there was a flan without a family of his own. Instead he collected simple, stupid things. None of which filled the void.

Phrase.value: Wouldn't it be nice to have more stuff?
I think of my collections as my real family.
Are children really that important?
Buying so many lovely packages makes me happy
When I ran out of closet space, I asked my wife to move out
Sad that I died with so little.

Description.value: Once there was a flan who could survive in the harshest environments with only the barest essentials. He died of food poisioning after eating at the local food court.

Phrase.value: Word to the wise, always build a shelter. Exposure is the primary cause of death out there in the wilds.
Did you know that you can squeeze water from animal dung? Think about it.
I can survive for days with nothing more than a couple of rocks, a nice sturdy stick, and a few drops of water.
The real trick to survival is the ability to embrace giardia.
Always build snares once you've established a shelter. You never know what you might catch.
I catch trout with my bare hands and eat them immediately. They are a great source of protein.

Description.value: Once there was a simple-minded flan with grand ambitions. He spent his days imagining grandeur while realizing none. It's a sad story really.

Phrase.value: Here's a tip: plastics. Think about it.
I don't know quite how to tell you this but I'm kind of a big deal.
Have you noticed how impressive my mountain is? Imposing isn't it?
I love lamps... Really any kind of lighting honestly.
I think I'll build a boat and sail across the ocean. Swimming makes me so tired.
I'm so thirsty... I'm also quite rugged. I pretty much never get thirsty.

Description.value: Once there was a flan who could see the future... or so he claimed. People began to wonder after he was killed by that bus.

Phrase.value: I'm getting a vision...
Yes, yes, you are very confused about your purpose in this world.
Your life line is very interesting. You don't see something like this very often.
I'm seeing something but it is oh so fuzzy. Perhaps a bit more gold will help bring it into view.
You have a great deal of enjoyment when building things but you often find yourself frusterated...
That's it. I'm done. I've seen all that I can. Come back again next week with more gold.

Description.value: Once there was a flan without a home of his own. He wandered the land, always seeking. He never did find his prize.

Phrase.value: Have you seen my ship? She may be old and wooden but she is quite swift. I call her Diversity.
Yes, yes, I have seen all that there is to see and then some. Just ask me and I'll tell you all about it.
Once I was chased by bandits across the rooftops of a city in the desert all because of a terrible misunderstanding involving rotten pastries.
Have you tried my spices? They are roundly praised as the best in all the seven kingdoms.
You call yourself royality? I've known royalty and you sir do not cut the mustard.
I think I'll go and climb to the top of a mountain.

Description.value: Once there was a flan without a family of his own. Instead he collected simple, stupid things. None of which filled the void.

Phrase.value: Wouldn't it be nice to have more stuff?
I think of my collections as my real family.
Are children really that important?
Buying so many lovely packages makes me happy
When I ran out of closet space, I asked my wife to move out
Sad that I died with so little.

Description.value: Once there was a baker of delicious bread. His mother insulted his pastries, so into the oven she went.

Phrase.value: Mother never liked my cooking.
Flour, flour everywhere!
If you turn the heat up in the cauldron, blubber just melts away
Oh, how I miss my yummy bread pudding.
I render my own fat. Savory.
What is death without cinnamon buns?

Description.value: Once there lived a gentleman of exquisite appetites. He failed to imagine that good things must end.

Phrase.value: With enough refinement, one becomes immortal
Fine brandies excite the mind
My life's accomplishment is my delicate tongue
Charming! Looks at all the little people
Even in death, I thirst for good wine
Hrumph. And you call yourself a civilization.

Description.value: Once there was a flan who was always available for dinner. Sadly his conversation was never as strong as his appetite.

Phrase.value: Are you going to eat that?
Have you ever been to a slaughter house? I visited one just last week and...
Did I ever tell you about my medical condition? It really is quite embarrassing...
You two really look like you are hitting it off. I think you'd make an adorable couple.
Is it my imagination or did that waiter just spit in your food?
It's a bit of a long story but I simply must tell you about my recent antiquing trip.

Description.value: Once there an builder with a great ego. She rejected all advice. And died alone.

Phrase.value: The individual is the source of all greatness!
Team players? Bah, you just couldn't cut it alone.
Vision. That is what I bring to my work
I drink to build and build to drink
Never let the group interfere with art
Carpentry is the highest calling

Description.value: Once there sat a well kept mistress. She still waits at her desk, contemplating his only gifts.

Phrase.value: Do you know what it is like to feel wanted?
All I had left were my pretty baubles
It is impossible to have two passions.
Once I was given a ring, though it meant nothing
Was I not better than her?
I learned that the heart dies long before the body.

Description.value: Once a balding admiral plotted treachery. He dreamt that power might make him love himself.

Phrase.value: When the command structure is broken, you fix it
I give orders. I do not take them.
I remember a body, a boat and a storm.
You! Set me soul at ease.
I just wanted to do one thing right in my life
Do you hear his choking on the grog? It is all I hear.

Description.value: Once there were married twins. He had a heart of ice and she had a heart of chocolate. Together they sought to take over the world. Again.

Phrase.value: Don't you just love pouring chocolate on a wound?
Wouldn't it be nice to take over the world?
We are amazing. Incredible, even.
We don't need to care for you. We have eachother.
She was born seconds before me. My beard is my consolation prize
Frozen cacao? It shatters when hit with a hammer.

Description.value: Once there was a brilliant beauty who demanded nothing short of excellence. He died alone never knowing anyone better than himself.

Phrase.value: I am a visionary, no?
The world has never known a ghost with such beauty.
Women find me irrestible. Men do as well.
Just take a moment to bask in my glow.
I demand the best. Only the true are worthy of my heart.
You should see me from the other side. I am even more beautiful from that angle.

Description.value: She hid her age behind the best teeth money could buy.

Phrase.value: The better to bite you with, my dear.
You seem so young and deliciously fresh.
I bought a pool so I could have poolboys
The faster my clock ticks, the sexier you become.
I love it when you card me.
Never underestimate the lust of an older woman

Description.value: Once there was a dark lorde with a beard of black bristle. When he conquered the world with sword and fire, he proclaimed "Look upon my lawn ornaments and despair!"

Phrase.value: I will crush you like I crushed the Jones.
My army of vile gnomes shall make quick work of you.
My nemesis shall never have a better lawn than I!
Yes, I made a pact with hell itself, but the improved ambiance was worth it.
Bow before my riding mower of Doom!

Description.value: Once there was an American from Florida. He mined the world bare in order to maintain his consumerist fantasia.

Phrase.value: Sometimes I lounge about wearing nothing but a pair of mouse ears
I only shop at highend stripmalls
My SUV makes me safer than all those other people
A four car garage just isn't enough
Doing my part to help the economy
I don't use my pool, but I like having it.

Description.value: Once there was a young queen (only 17) that would freak out whenever she saw village people.

Phrase.value: Let them eat cake. Mmm...Cake.
It is Saturday night and I've got a fever. Poor me.
You should be dancing
Is that a spark in your pants? Weird.
I want a sequined man with hips like a bullwhip
Diamonds are forever

Description.value: Once a golden youth, his love of elderberry aged him prematurely

Phrase.value: My father smelt of elderberry. I so looked up to him.
Of wine and women, I took the wine.
Rapscallion! I've drunk a barrel for each day you've lived
Why don't you give, grandpa a little swig?
Want wisdom? Never leave a glass half full.

Description.value: Once a widow paced her manor's high walk, hoping that her sea captain's ship would ride out the storm

Phrase.value: I made him his favorite chowder, but it grew cold.
Do you see the Captain? My eyes fail me.
Such a chilly fog...damn this weather.
I don't remember falling.

Description.value: Once a lady found a kitten. And another. And another. They found her smothered with love

Phrase.value: My little woogums loves fishy fishy. Yes. Yesss.
Oh, you love it when I scratch you there.
Stop meowing! I'll feed you. Please. Please stop.
What stink? I don't smell a thing
Sometimes I just let them lick me for hours

Description.value: He chopped the tree with all his might. It fell left instead of right.

Phrase.value: Trees are really big. And heavy.
As a child, I pined to be a lumberjack
If you stick out a wet finger, the cold side is where the wind is blowing
I can believe I got squashed by the first tree I cut down...
Anyone have any bandages?

Description.value: She dreams of rocks as light and fluffy as clouds.

Phrase.value: I've learned that cave-ins hurt.
I've got muscles like a young ox.

Description.value: She thought it was cheese, but it in fact it was milk her grandmother left her.

Phrase.value: Expiration dates are a scam to make you buy more
The layers of old fat on my pans give my food flavor!
I discovered I could cook much faster if I didn't wash
Plates are cleaned naturally if you eat off them.
Soap has too many bubbles to be trusted

Description.value: He dipped his pole in the watering hole and bemoaned the lack of fish in the sea

Phrase.value: A hook. A line. A pretty face. Two out of three should be enough.
I don't understand fish and don't think I ever will.
I figure if I fish long enough someone will like me again.
The last one got away.
Do fish really care about how nicely you dress?

Description.value: The Queen wasn't happy when he dropped her crown jewels down the grate

Phrase.value: My job involves tiny tweezers and tiny gems
If you squeeze too tightly, PLING! There it goes!
Once I fell into the display case. Stupid shoes.
Never make the Queen angry.

Description.value: A man bear met a real bear outside the bare bar.

Phrase.value: Why wear shirts when I've got such luxurious chest hair?
Naked lumberjacks aren't just a phase you go through.
Just me, my ax and all that nature! Who need pants?
When I see a bear I just want to hug him
I think of myself as more a warm weather person.

Description.value: She sampled each brew with a bowlful of stew, twenty eight times a leap day.

Phrase.value: Beer before liquor, never sicker.
If I drink another bite, I'll explode. And then I did.
I lived for beer.
Ambers, ales, lagers, stouts, pilsners, lambics, rauchbiers!
I'm both top and bottom fermented now

Description.value: He discovered that one should be careful where one places their kisser

Phrase.value: Don't call me "Hot lips"
Pipes were my biggest seller.
I'm feeling a tad fried.
I was so cool when I started

Description.value: In large quantities, anything can be a poison. Even nightshade

Phrase.value: I think the Atropa belladonna was mislabeled
I thought I was taking something for my gout
Mix a little mint in and you cover the taste
Nothing like a nice mortar and pestle

Description.value: His last night at the shop, he swallowed 10 goose egg diamonds. One too many.

Phrase.value: Do you trust your jeweler?
My what pretty gems. Mind if I take a quick look?
I've got something stuck in my throat.
That looks expensive. May I hold it?

Description.value: He sat down and wept until nothing came out and then he died.

Phrase.value: I wanted to be a writer
What is the point?
My hair's naturally black.
I don't actually like whiskey. Hurts my stomach
Never remembered my dreams, not once

Body.value: Once a widow paced her manor's high walk, hoping that her sea captain's ship would ride out the storm.
Well that was difficult!

DisplayName.value: Test Ghost of the Tiny Baby

Body.value: Once a widow paced her manor's high walk, hoping that her sea captain's ship would ride out the storm.
Well that was difficult!
Deliver wood to the ice altar to free the ghost.
Well done!
Onto the next ghost!
Use your factory to craft bricks. Then deliver those to the ghost.
Very clever!
Persistence is key in vanquishing ghosts
Satisfy both altars to vanquish the ghost. Use the Recipedia if you need help.
What does he see in that glass?
Melt your way to the surrounding ice towers and deliver the requested goods. If all towers are liberated in a single Leap Day, the Fortress will be destroyed!
Good job!
You are now ready to build cities with the other princes and princesses
Melt your way to the surrounding ice towers and deliver the requested goods. If all towers are liberated in a single Leap Day, the Fortress will be destroyed!
Well that was difficult!

Melt your way to the surrounding ice towers and deliver the requested goods. If all towers are liberated in a single Leap Day, the Fortress will be destroyed!
Flans prosper together
Melt your way to the surrounding ice towers and deliver the requested goods. If all towers are liberated in a single Leap Day, the Fortress will be destroyed!
Well done!
Be sure to thank your fellow nobles.
Melt your way to the surrounding ice towers and deliver the requested goods. If all towers are liberated in a single Leap Day, the Fortress will be destroyed!
That was a great group effort!
Rumors tell of more dangerous ghosts...
Melt your way to the surrounding ice towers and deliver the requested goods. If all towers are liberated in a single Leap Day, the Fortress will be destroyed!
Cougarina will rise again
She will never leave you alone...
Your defeat is inevitable, but perhaps the experience will result in better lawns
By my bristly black beard, you have released me!
I don't think you can keep up with me.
I am released from my suburban hell.
The queen of dance!
Take me home tonight
